project.name: samples
project.description:
Example of using pldoc Ant task to document an entire database. Run it using a command like this:
ant -f ant_enterprise example.xml
NB: if you are using Java 1.4 or later, you'll need to override the embedded XML classes. iN Java 1.4, the simplest way to do this is to define environment variable ANT_OPTS before running Ant:
export ANT_OPTS="-Djava.endorsed.dirs=$PLDOC_HOME/target -Dpldoc.home=${PLDOC_HOME}"
or on Windows:
set ANT_OPTS=-Djava.endorsed.dirs=%PLDOC_HOME%\target -Dpldoc.home=%PLDOC_HOME%
where PLDOC_HOME is the directory where pldoc is installed.
${project.build.finalName}-jar-with-dependencies.jar contains all runtime Xalan and Xerces classes to run PLDoc successfully.
